alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Martin; Pitt; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 10:53PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of eastern North Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Martin, Pitt and Washington. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1053 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Washington, Plymouth, Roper, Pactolus, Hinson, Wenona, Westover, Pleasant Grove, Old Ford, Mackeys, Long Acre VFD, Jamesville, Grimesland, Simpson, Smithwick and Dardens. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
